intro: Campylospermum reticulatum, commonly known as the net-veined campylospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with a distinctive net-like venation pattern. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often with five petals. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil conditions.
